TEXT: The applicant [ Mr PERSON ] is an NORP national , born in PERSON ( GPE ) in DATE . He lives in PERSON . He was represented before the Court by Mr J .- PERSON , of FAC .
The facts , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant came to GPE with his family in DATE , when he was DATE . He lived in GPE continuously until he was deported to GPE in DATE .
In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG for the Rhône département convicted the applicant of a number of offences of armed robbery , and of hostage - taking . It sentenced him to DATE imprisonment .
Following that conviction , the Minister of the ORG made an order for his deportation on DATE under section CARDINAL of PERSON and Residence ) Ordinance of DATE , as amended .
On DATE the applicant , relying , inter alia , on LAW , applied to ORG to quash the deportation order . His application was dismissed on DATE .

The applicant appealed to the ORG d’Etat . In a judgment of DATE the ORG d’Etat upheld ORG judgment . In respect of the applicant ’s allegation that there had been a violation of LAW , the ORG d’Etat ruled as follows :

“ Despite the applicant ’s claim that the order in question interfered with his private and family life , the documents in the case file show that Mr GPE , aged CARDINAL on the date of the order in question , unmarried and with no dependants , was not entirely without links with his country of origin , that country being , moreover , the one in which he had chosen to perform his military service ; under the circumstances , and having regard to the seriousness of the offences committed by the appellant , the measure in question did not exceed what was necessary to preserve public order and did not breach the provisions of LAW ; ”
